text: Later David defeated the Philistines and subdued them. David took Metheg Ammah from the Philistines.

He <st data-num="05221" class="">defeated</st> the <st data-num="04124" class="">Moabites</st>. He made them <st data-num="07901" class="">lie</st> on the <st data-num="0776" class="">ground</st> and then used a <st data-num="02256" class="">rope</st> to <st data-num="04058" class="">measure</st> them <st data-num="04058" class="">off</st>. He <st data-num="04058" class="">put</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st>-<st data-num="02256" class="">thirds</st> of them to <st data-num="04191" class="">death</st> and <st data-num="02421" class="">spared</st> the <st data-num="04393" class="">other</st> <st data-num="02256" class="">third</st>.<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="04124" class="">Moabites</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">became</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">subjects</st> and <st data-num="05375" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="04503" class="">tribute</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">defeated</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="07340" class="">Rehob</st> of <st data-num="06678" class="">Zobah</st> when he <st data-num="01980" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="07725" class="">reestablish</st><n id="1" /> his <st data-num="03027" class="">authority</st><n id="2" /> over the <st data-num="06578" class="">Euphrates</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="05104" class="">River</st>.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="03920" class="">seized</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> him <st data-num="0505 07651 03967">1,700</st> <st data-num="06571" class="">charioteers</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="06242 0505">20,000</st> <st data-num="0376 07273">infantrymen</st>. <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="06131" class="">cut the hamstrings of</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03498 04480">but</st> <st data-num="03967 07393">100</st> of the <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot horses</st>.<n id="2" />

The <st data-num="0758" class="">Arameans</st> of <st data-num="01834" class="">Damascus</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="05826" class="">help</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer</st> of <st data-num="06678" class="">Zobah</st>, but <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="06242 08147 0505 0376">22,000</st> of the <st data-num="0758" class="">Arameans</st>.
David placed garrisons in the territory of the Arameans of Damascus; the Arameans became David’s subjects and brought tribute. The Lord protected David wherever he campaigned.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="02091" class="">golden</st> <st data-num="07982" class="">shields</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">belonged</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> and <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> them to <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" />
From Tebah and Berothai, Hadadezer’s cities, King David took a great deal of bronze.
When King Toi of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer,

<st data-num="08583" class="">he</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="03141" class="">Joram</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> to <st data-num="07592" class="">extend</st> his <st data-num="07965" class="">best wishes</st><n id="3" /> and to <st data-num="01288" class="">pronounce a blessing on</st> him <st data-num="05921 0834">for</st> his <st data-num="03898 05221">victory</st> over <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="08583" class="">Toi</st> had <st data-num="01961" class="">been</st> <st data-num="0376 04421">at war</st> with <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer</st>.<n id="4" /> He <st data-num="01961" class="">brought</st> with <st data-num="03027" class="">him</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">various items</st> made of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, and <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>.<n id="5" />
King David dedicated these things to the Lord, along with the dedicated silver and gold that he had taken from all the nations that he had subdued,
including Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and Amalek. This also included some of the plunder taken from King Hadadezer son of Rehob of Zobah.
David became famous when he returned from defeating the Edomites in the Valley of Salt; he defeated 18,000 in all.
He placed garrisons throughout Edom, and all the Edomites became David’s subjects. The Lord protected David wherever he campaigned.
David reigned over all Israel; he guaranteed justice for all his people.
Joab son of Zeruiah was general in command of the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was secretary;

<st data-num="06659" class="">Zadok</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0285" class="">Ahitub</st> and <st data-num="0288" class="">Ahimelech</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="054" class="">Abiathar</st><n id="1" /> were <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>; <st data-num="08304" class="">Seraiah</st> was <st data-num="05608" class="">scribe</st>;
Benaiah son of Jehoiada supervised the Kerethites and Pelethites; and David’s sons were priests.
